instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Hello everybody;

I m working on 820-4924 (Retina 13" 2015) no backlight problem, No liquid damage or drop. Tried another known good LCD and data cable.

- F7700 = ok and 12.5V
- Replaced U7700 nothing change
- BKLT_EN_R = 3.3V
- PPVIN_S0W_LCDBKLT_R 12.5V ok
- LCDBKLT_EN_L is 12.5V ( it must be low i think)
- PPVIN_S0SW-LCDBKLT is 0v
- SMC_LID = 3.32V

where can i check next step?

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: Are you absolutely sure you have an image on the LCD?

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: Yes Duke. When i put the light behind lcd i can see image.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: Check data lines continuity from LCD connector pin 3 and 4 to U7700. Check voltage on pin 8 on LCD connector.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

LCD pin 3 and 4 shows 5V; LCD pin 8 is 0v; EDP_BKLT_EN is 3.3V

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: Read my question again and post your findings.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: When checked dataline pin 3 and 4 connecting to u7700 without problem.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: Are you sure you checked with a known good panel from a 2015+ model? Anything else does not work.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message:
I dont have full case.. but i have 2015 13" LCD and old models LCD data cable its same problem no backlight :(
Can i put DC to DC converter like this ( [url]http://www.aliexpress.com/item/1pc-Module-4-75V-24V-to-0-92V-15V-DC-DC-Power-Supply-Buck-Converter-Step/32582253910.html[/url] ) and inject backlight voltage directly?

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
threads.message: So you are using a 2013 LCD cable.......yeah I'm not sure that will work, actually I'm pretty sure they are different, look at the pinout between the boards. Stop messing around and get proper test parts.

threads.title: 820-4924-A No Backlight
